DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Reuse Template Study Activity Foci Date and Time Range ISO21090.QTY.IVL.TS.DATETIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An activity defined at a global library level that identifies one of a set of conditions that a subject must meet in order to participate in a study, or that a study subject must meet into order to participate in a certain part of the study. The time period in which the observation result is held to be true, expressed either as a simple date range or as an evaluable expression that references a study-defined date or milestone. EXAMPLE(S): For a survey question, "Have you traveled to Europe between 1990 and 1999?", the focalDateRange would be "January 1, 1990 to December 31, 1999". For the question, "Have you smoked in the last 2 months", the focalDateRange would be an expression referencing a variable that represents the PerformedObservation.actualDateRange (a value yet to be defined) and a formula for the date range between when the question is asked (PerformedObservation.actualDateRange.low) and 2 months prior (PerformedObservation.actualDateRange.low - 2 months).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Reuse Template Study Activity Foci Date and Time Range
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._Area of greatest concentration, attention, or activity; a central point or locus, especially of an infection.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Observation Reuse Template Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: Area of greatest concentration, attention, or activity; a central point or locus, especially of an infection.:An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.

Concepts.definition: Area of greatest concentration, attention, or activity; a central point or locus, especially of an infection.
An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.
